channel.title: Comments on: Book Review: Level Up 9

item.title: By: avijit ghosh
item.dc:creator: avijit ghosh
item.description: Hi Ben I suppose I am good with this.. though the cut ends up being between the 5,3 and and 7,3 stone (which is much further out) rather than the 3,4 and the 5,3 stone .. thanks again
item.content:encoded: Hi Ben I suppose I am good with this.. though the cut ends up being between the 5,3 and and 7,3 stone (which is much further out) rather than the 3,4 and the 5,3 stone .. thanks again

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: In regards to a local exchange, White's corner is rather large in this problem; but this exchange could be excellent if we assume Black has a moyo/wall on the right already. So one thing to keep in mind for the Level Up Series is that the key thing they're training is technique. Unless a whole board is presented, don't worry to much about global context. Does that make sense?
item.content:encoded:
In regards to a local exchange, White’s corner is rather large in this problem; but this exchange could be excellent if we assume Black has a moyo/wall on the right already.
So one thing to keep in mind for the Level Up Series is that the key thing they’re training is technique. Unless a whole board is presented, don’t worry to much about global context. Does that make sense?

item.title: By: Avi
item.dc:creator: Avi
item.description: Yes level 8 ... At the end of the sequence.. White can capture at 3,3 for move 8 ... This seems really bad for black?
item.content:encoded: Yes level 8 … At the end of the sequence.. White can capture at 3,3 for move 8 … This seems really bad for black?

item.title: By: Avi
item.dc:creator: Avi
item.description: Ahh that makes sense thanks much!

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Are you talking about Level Up 8 for this one as well? And if so, are you wondering why the descent at 2-4 is necessary?
item.content:encoded: Are you talking about Level Up 8 for this one as well? And if so, are you wondering why the descent at 2-4 is necessary?

item.title: By: Ben
item.dc:creator: Ben
item.description: Alright. So for Page 64 - Problem 24 (Level Up 8). If White 2 at 5-5 point, then Black will take the 3-1 point to make miai for the second eye at 6-1 or 5-2 (since White has to throw in in order to falsify it. Let me know if it's still confusing.
item.content:encoded: Alright. So for Page 64 – Problem 24 (Level Up 8). If White 2 at 5-5 point, then Black will take the 3-1 point to make miai for the second eye at 6-1 or 5-2 (since White has to throw in in order to falsify it. Let me know if it’s still confusing.

item.content:encoded: Also check out page 55 prob. 3 that cut isn’t really the problem cut ( and feels like a terrible cut to be honest because of the sacrifice )

item.title: By: avijit
item.dc:creator: avijit
item.description: i've noticed you have been catching a few of the mistakes in these series ... take a look at page 64 problem 24.. I don't think this is solvable.. as white has another move 2 that is at the 5,5 point.. am I missing something?
item.content:encoded: i’ve noticed you have been catching a few of the mistakes in these series … take a look at page 64 problem 24.. I don’t think this is solvable.. as white has another move 2 that is at the 5,5 point.. am I missing something?
